source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Glumes awned; annual or (P. lutosus) perennial
Lemma unawned; glumes cleft for a quarter to half their length, bearing hollow, inflated bristles near base; plant rarely more than 15 cm high
Lemma awned; glumes slightly notched, scabrous; plant normally 30 cm high or more
Spikelet falling as a unit (i.e. with glumes attached) at maturity; glumes with awn more than 3.5 mm long
Glumes persisting on plant after remainder of mature spikelet has fallen; glumes with awn up to 3.5 mm long
